author: Orion

posts.content:
The Epic Elf-Lord

Image source: https://images.discerningassets.com/ima ... smqp94.jpg


Design notes:
I really disliked my original build design and I really didn't want to play it, so I re-did it with the knowledge I had gained:

-> put EDR III in the build
-> took Epic Dodge earlier 

Ranged AB is 47, melee AB is 38 with a rapier. Sneak attack 8d6. Enchant arrow 11 (+11 dmg / hit)
Base 520hp.
Fort 29(33), Reflex 31(35) + Evasion/IE, Will 17(23) - Saves vs spells are in () Brackets
Max Stealth/Spot, UMD 30 [has wizard in the build], Tumble 40, Spellcraft 20, Set Trap 15, Search etc.
Dex AC is protected by uncanny dodge.

EDR I - EDR III between level 27 and 33.
Epic Dodge at level 36.

The Will save looks bad but with save 23 against spells and slippery mind it might be ok.
One will want prot v evil / clarity potions / lesser mind blank / mind blank though.
Greater Dispelling and Mords is going to be tricky to handle, the best solution I think is to just have clarity pots on the quickbar. 

The Fort save is was troublesome to me. To kill this guy I am thinking -> dev crit / implosion. This is why I prioritised Epic Fortitude over Epic Prowess.
One will want to cap cons + equip fortitude boosting gear to try and ensure he can tank that stuff. With +6 from cons and +5 fort items the fort save the Fort save hits 40(44), meaning anyone with Dev Crit DC 41 he will need to roll a 1 to fail such a roll, and he is difficult to implode. 
Epic Fortitude comes late, but it is difficult to fit this in earlier with the EDR III + Epic Dodge I wanted to fit in beforehand.

Knockdown immunity boots/items will be desired if you truly want to tank to protect dodge/tumble AC.

Mages will always be a problem of course. I am tempted to drop Rapid Shot or Called Shot for Knockdown, but the melee AB is only 38. 

Anyway now that this has been re-designed this looks much nicer to play.

Appreciate suggestions/comments with the redesigned build.

Original post:
This is an elven rogue arcane archer that attempts to be useful in melee and very powerful at range.

Elf for keen senses, bonuses to detection and dexterity. 

Rogue 13 for Uncanny Dodge, Evasion, Epic Dodge, 7d6 sneak attack and great skills.
Arcane archer 25 for Enchant Arrow XIII and a full BAB class pre-epic.
Wizard 2 for a few useful level 1 spells and to qualify for AA without exp penalties as an elf.

It is feat starved without Fighter or Champion of Torm, but I manage my best, and Rogue is necessary for Uncanny Dodge (other choices would be Barbarian, Assassin or Shadowdancer, Rogue appeared to be the best here). 

Melee Base AB is 40 which is decent considering 15 levels of non-combat classes and no melee weapon foci. 
Useful melee feats include Weapon Finesse, Knockdown, Blind Fight, Called Shot, Toughness, Great Dexterity VII and Epic Dodge. 

Ranged Base AB is 54, which is more than enough. Damage output-> 7d6 sneak plus 13 damage from Enchant arrow, plus mighty bonuses (2 to 8 depending if Str is capped). 

HP is 400+, naked AC is 30. 318 skill points to invest into whatever you would like. 

Looking through the archives, there are a few Rogue/AAs but none go as AA deep. I understand it is usually optimal to go deep with AA.

Anyway, interested to hear your suggestions/thoughts/tweaks on this build concept, numbers wise it looks good. 

Epic Dodge is late, but I wanted to go AA deep. TrueStrike Rogue gets ED at 36 with a Rogue 14/Wizard 3/AA 23 split, maybe that split is better? Or even a Rogue 15 / Wizard 2 / AA 23 split?

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
I typically go with the idea that going deep AA allows you some flexibility in other areas that no other class/feat allows. Meaning you can play a 13 Dex archer using a longbow. However you could just as easily play a 3 Bard / 24 cleric /13 AA netting +6/+6 archery. Which, admittedly on a cleric is not quite as useful as other classes but still is useful.

I do find however, that partial AA builds lack the full power that min/max AA offers. A 10 Dex archer with 47 AB and DevCrit for ranged and melee is amazing. I shelved my Ba/RDD/AA and went with your build instead ... with elf mind you, not HElf :)

I've redone the build, put EDR III and put Epic Dodge earlier, it looks nicer, appreciate any comments/suggestions

Do you think I should drop Epic Fort for Epic Will?

Also dealing with mages. Sadly I think this will just be stealth / UMD, maybe traps. Catch em before they catch you is all I can think of. Or try to play their game, with time stop / mord / breach / bigby.
